etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Reinhold Forster (1729–1798). From mitre + wort, after the shape of the young fruit

definitions: Now in full "false mitrewort". A tiarella (foamflower), especially T. cordifolia.
Any of several small tropical American herbaceous plants of the genera Mitreola and Cynoctonum (family Loganiaceae); especially Cynoctonum mitreola.
